page.title: 09New Industry in Craft Work.
page.content: Most residents in this area of Kent are employed in farming, shops and services. One firm which has been recently established is Eric Albinson Design. They have converted the old Glassenbury Timber Yard into workrooms for making highly original wooden articles - clocks, jewellery boxes, mirrors and desk accessories. Eric Albinson recently won the coveted Crucible of Creation Award for a wooden lap-desk. He has also got Design Centre approval for many other items. One especially made jewellery box in walnut was presented to Prince Charles. They are a small personal firm turning out beautifully hand-finished objects marketed around the world and are hoping to expand soon. The Timber Yard was used by the Glassenbury Estate for many years to turn their own trees into such necessary items as gates & fences.
